bill_title: establish or increase certain penalties related to election and voting offenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish or increase certain penalties related to election and voting offenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 12-26-3 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-3. Any person who, at the time of requesting his name to be registered as a voter, or who at the time of offering his vote voting at any election, knowingly makes any false statement or employs any false representation to procure his name to be registered or his vote to be received to vote , is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor Class 6 felony . A false statement or representation made or used in the presence and to the knowledge of a person requesting his name to be registered, or offering his to vote, is to be deemed made by himself the person if it appears that it was made or used in support of his the person's claim to be registered or to vote, that he the person knew it to be false , and that he the person allowed it to pass uncontradicted. Section 2. That § 12-26-4 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-4. Any person knowing himself or herself not to be a qualified voter who votes or offers to vote at any election is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor Class 6 felony . Section 3. That § 12-26-8 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-8. A person who votes more than once at any election or who offers to vote after having once voted, either in the same or in another election precinct, is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor Class 6 felony . Section 4. That § 12-26-14 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-14. It is a Class 1 misdemeanor Class 6 felony for any person, directly or indirectly, to promise or threaten to grant or withhold or to cause to be granted or withheld, any public relief, assistance loans, or grants for the purpose or with the intention of controlling or influencing the political affiliations, party registration, support or vote at any election, of any person so promised or threatened. The terms , " public relief " and " assistance " , include all forms of direct public relief and also all forms of indirect relief such as employment on any public works or project. The terms , " loans " and " grants " , include all forms of financial assistance granted by the federal government or any of its agencies and also by this state or any of its political subdivisions. Section 5. That § 12-26-15 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-15. It is a Class 2 Class 1 misdemeanor for any person, directly or indirectly, by himself or through any other person: (1) To pay, lend, contribute, or offer or promise to pay, lend, or contribute, any money or other valuable consideration, to or for any voter or to or for any other person , to : (a) To induce such the voter to vote or refrain from voting at any election or to ; (b) To induce any voter to vote or refrain from voting at such the election for any particular person or to ; (c) To induce such the voter to go to the polls or remain away from the polls at such the election , or on ; or (d) On account of such the voter having voted, refrained from voting or having voted or refrained from voting for any particular person, or having gone to the polls or remained away from the polls at such the election; (2) To give, offer, or promise any office, place, or employment, or to promise to procure or endeavor to procure any office, place, or employment to or for any voter, or to or for any other person in order to induce such the voter to vote or refrain from voting at such the election for any particular person; (3) To make any gift, loan, or promise, offer, procurement, or agreement as aforesaid to, for, or with any person in order to induce such the person to procure or endeavor to procure the election of any person, or the vote of any voter at any election; (4) To procure or engage, promise, or endeavor to procure, in consequence of any such gift, loan, offer, promise, procurement, or agreement, the election of any person or the vote of any voter at such the election; (5) To advance or pay, or cause to be paid, any money or other valuable thing to or for the use of any other person, with the intent that the same or any part thereof shall be used in bribery at any election, or to knowingly pay or cause to be paid any money or other valuable thing to any person in discharge or repayment of any money wholly or in part expended in bribery at any election. Section 6. That § 12-26-27 be amended to read as follows: 12-26-27. A Any person who gives or offers a bribe to any precinct superintendent, precinct deputy, canvasser, or other officer of an election as a consideration for doing or omitting to do any act in violation of the person's official duty in relation to such election, is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor Class 6 felony . Section 7. That chapter 12-26 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: It is a Class 6 felony for any person to intentionally: (1) Misrepresent the person's identity in applying for a ballot, depositing a ballot in a ballot box, or attempting to vote by means of a voting machine or electronic voting system; (2) Aid, abet, counsel, or procure another to go into any precinct for the purpose of voting in that precinct, knowing that the other person is not eligible to vote in that precinct; (3) Cause or attempt to cause the person's name to be registered in any precinct if the person is not eligible to vote; (4) Misrepresent the person's identity when attempting to register to vote; (5) Make or sign any false certificate required by this title; (6) Make any false or untrue statement in any application for absentee ballots; (7) Apply for absentee ballots more than once in any election with the intent to cast an illegal ballot; (8) Do any act in violation of the provisions of this title for the purpose of casting an illegal vote or for the purpose of aiding another to cast an illegal vote; (9) Alter an absentee ballot application after it has been signed by the voter, except by an election official for administrative purposes; or (10) Aid, abet, counsel, or procure any other individual to violate this section.
